intro: Hexaptera famatinensis, commonly known as the Famatinian hexaptera, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in dry, rocky environments and is often found in limestone areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
